Author: jl777c#5810
Content: shossain's test plan is the best testplan I have ever seen for CC contracts

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course as soon as it is improved, then it is being improved

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Thanks James. I'll get the rest of the RPC calls done along with summary page üòÉ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one easy way to expand a test plan is to make sure each bug found has a specific test point, so if we had the test plan, we are sure to find it. and even if it isnt a bug, what works now might break later, so each bug usually gives an idea to several test points

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for each rpc call being tested there is a set of test points, with several different "time to do the test" and "severity of bug", clearly we want to front load the quick to run tests that finds major fatal issues before even starting on tests that take avery long time to find minor bugs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: testing is a resource allocation problem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: given infinite resources, just test everything with each release.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but this is not practical

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the goal is to get as close to the same result as if we are testing everything with every release

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: though with automated tests it would be possible to come really close to this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: even with manual testing in prioritized order it should be possible to come reasonably close

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and the ultimate result is whether we find all the important to fix bugs before it is released

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
Was able to use the same name twice by broadcasting 2 `rewardscreatefunding` txs in 1 block
```
./komodo-cli -ac_name=AT1 rewardsinfo cfc823f1b89f8947918f6454105e2a65d7a71722ac37eba3e5ffd80b8230cfc0
{
  "result": "success",
  "fundingtxid": "cfc823f1b89f8947918f6454105e2a65d7a71722ac37eba3e5ffd80b8230cfc0",
  "name": "double",
  "sbits": 111516182736740,
  "APR": "10000.00000000",
  "minseconds": 86400,
  "maxseconds": 172800,
  "mindeposit": "1.00000000",
  "funding": "100.00000000"
}
~/komodo/src$ ./komodo-cli -ac_name=AT1 rewardsinfo 9d5250b295390e548e57af842c2f19d6e384b9a4d930a8a612eab5d265877481
{
  "result": "success",

  "name": "double",

  "APR": "10000.00000000",
  "minseconds": 86400,
  "maxseconds": 172800,
  "mindeposit": "1.00000000",

}
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i am getting `configure: error: Cannot enable RELRO` on various compilers

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i took a chainsaw to configure.ac

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
```diff --git a/configure.ac b/configure.ac
index 7de40ff..33bcf51 100644
--- a/configure.ac
+++ b/configure.ac
@@ -507,8 +507,8 @@ if test x$use_hardening != xno; then

   if test x$TARGET_OS != xwindows; then
     # All windows code is PIC, forcing it on just adds useless compile warnings
-    AX_CHECK_LINK_FLAG([[-Wl,-z,relro]], [HARDENED_LDFLAGS="$HARDENED_LDFLAGS -Wl,-z,relro"],[AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot enable RELRO)])
-    AX_CHECK_LINK_FLAG([[-Wl,-z,now]], [HARDENED_LDFLAGS="$HARDENED_LDFLAGS -Wl,-z,now"],[AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot enable BIND_NOW)])
+    # AX_CHECK_LINK_FLAG([[-Wl,-z,relro]], [HARDENED_LDFLAGS="$HARDENED_LDFLAGS -Wl,-z,relro"],[AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot enable RELRO)])
+    # AX_CHECK_LINK_FLAG([[-Wl,-z,now]], [HARDENED_LDFLAGS="$HARDENED_LDFLAGS -Wl,-z,now"],[AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot enable BIND_NOW)])
     AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([-fPIE],[HARDENED_CXXFLAGS="$HARDENED_CXXFLAGS -fPIE"],[AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot enable -fPIE)])
     AX_CHECK_LINK_FLAG([[-pie]], [HARDENED_LDFLAGS="$HARDENED_LDFLAGS -pie"],[AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot enable -pie)])
   else``` is required for me to build on OS X, tried gcc 6 and 7
